intro: Rhodognaphalopsis coriacea subsp. orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco hairy everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought tolerance. Its subshrub form features woody stems and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
